Does anyone here use Forest? (<https://www.forestapp.cc/>) I'm getting such an absurdly high EV from this thing I'd be willing to buy it (only $2.50) for any of my fellow EAs if you think you'll ever use it with me (we are in the same timezone and can be working on separate projects to grow together). Far from being altruistic I'll buy it because it's such a boon to my productivity if I use it with someone. :stuck_out_tongue:

I've used other productivity app, but this one takes the cake for me.

attachments.title: Forest
attachments.text: Forest is an app helping you stay away from your smartphone and stay focused on your work.

1547221263.022400 UCYR5CCG3.text:
"Employers responded to high unemployment by making their job descriptions more stringent. When unemployment went down thanks to the demand-side recovery, suddenly employers got more relaxed again... In other words, the skills gap was the consequence of high unemployment rather than its cause. With workers plentiful, employers got choosier. Rather than investing in training workers, they demanded lots of experience and educational credentials."

<https://www.vox.com/2019/1/7/18166951/skills-gap-modestino-shoag-ballance>

attachments.title: The "skills gap" was a lie
attachments.text: New research shows it was the consequence of high unemployment rather than its cause.
attachments.fallback: Vox: The "skills gap" was a lie

1547704090.036200 UBX307C94.text: Or... maybe this issue is bypassed if you're on ios?

1547704055.035900 UBX307C94.text:
<https://www.androidcentral.com/biggest-feature-google-play-missing-gifting-content>

Shit this is a surprise. Busy skimming options. Do you know how to gift things on the play store?

attachments.title: The biggest feature Google Play is missing: Gifting content
attachments.text: The gift of Android is a sweet one, to be sure, no thanks to Google Play and it's utter lack of variety in gift-giving. While gifting content has existed on other platforms since before Android existed, it's an utter shame it hasn't come to Google Play yet.
attachments.fallback: Android Central: The biggest feature Google Play is missing: Gifting content

1547760469.047100 UCZVBKX63.text:
1. Peter Singer's TED talk. This is now quite out of date, and is very focused on charity and global poverty, but it still does a good job of conveying some of the core motivation behind EA

<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Diuv3XZQXyc>

2. This presentation originally given by Julia Wise and Jeff Kaufman. It is a bit on a basic side but gives an fairly good overview.

<https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1OyVw_aHXjjvhRbYvrmgs_Ta-VTfriWMrsIWdL26r1Xk/edit#slide=id.g11aa437f8_014>

3. This introduction to 80K talk given by Bren Todd in 2016 is again a little out of date, but provides a good introduction to 80Ks approach. Its split into a lot of different videos, and ends up being quite long overall (approx 1.5 hours).

<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2VRL-ByuQuo&list=PL-BRtcBm4Yj6ZpOG49cbHut0gtuCEVXfk>

1547757957.046500 U0992K37U.text:

```
Goals:
* thinking about career beyond self
* awareness of EA as a moral technique
* engagement with EA community
* becoming an "EA"

Itinerary:
* 12:20 - students go to lunch, lecture hall is open
* 12:25 - intro (Jon)
* 12:30 - talk (Haseeb)
* 12:50 - EA community rep (Erica?)
* 12:55 - dismissed to lunch & hangout

Other topics:
* Volunteers
    * who are they?
    * what should they do?
    * should we point them out?
* Call to action
    * point out ways to be involved
    * future events
```

1548110084.005800 UCYR5CCG3.text: Here is the google doc I'm compiling resources to (work in progress): <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1R62Z8F-MJhxLSEzk7b6mQA9a9dhwq1kf-aTTM7bynuA/edit?usp=sharing>

1548104853.004900 U0992K37U.text:
Current plan is to do a short Q&A chat with he and I after the talk to ensure EA questions get asked. After that we'll open it up to everyone for all questions.

Here's our current set of questions for Haseeb that will serve as the basis of the "fireside chat". If you have any that you would like to add, please post them here.

```
* Background:
    * What's your story?
    * Who are you?
    * How did you become the person you are?
    * How have you changed over the years?
* EA influence on him:
    * How did you get into EA?
    * What did you find compelling about EA?
    * What resources have influenced you?
    * Were there any "aha" / watershed moments / tipping points for you?
* Motivation:
    * How did EA affect your career decisions?
    * What are the principles that guide your career decisions?
    * Why, specifically, have you made the decisions you have?
    * What motivates you?
* Strategy / Goal:
    * How do you define doing good?
    * What's your most important "cause area"?
    * What are you optimizing for?
    * What metric/metrics do you look at to define success?
    * What are the main charities you're giving to?
    * Is it possible to do more harm with your work than you do good through charity?
        * How do you navigate that tension?
* Personal Success
    * What are the factors that have driven your success?
    * Do you have any advice for our students going through the job search?
```

1548222218.008800 U0992K37U.text:
<@U03SSFD3H> It occurs to me that we had initially said 12:25 to start, but we'll need to begin at 12:15. It would be helpful if you could be here by noon to get everything set up, but if not we'll have some time while people are eating.

*The new itinerary:*

11:30 - set up food in Hopper, mic checks, etc.
12:15 - students filter into lecture hall. I introduce the event and the people involved. Potentially Erica talks about the community here.
12:20 - students dismissed to Hopper to eat. Volunteers circulate.
12:40 - presentation begins (if < 50 people, we stay in Hopper, otherwise the lecture hall)
1:15 - Haseeb & Jon chat (will drop if insufficient time)
1:20 - open Q&A + checkin reminder
1:28 - Note about the Ethics group & plug for Friday meeting
1:30 - dismissal

1548201433.013500 U0992K37U.text:
Yeah, that should work. I think this particular audience will be more interested in your path and career choices, even independently of EA, so don't short-change those parts too much.

You and I can do a little front-of-the-room Q&A to ensure those topics get covered followed by an open Q&A. Note that your celebrity status here is bound to skew the questions toward the personal.
